verses.verse: If one be found<WH4672> slain<WH2491> in the land<WH127> which the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee to possess<WH3423> it, lying<WH5307> in the field<WH7704>, and it be not known<WH3045> who hath slain<WH5221> him:
Then thy elders<WH2205> and thy judges<WH8199> shall come forth<WH3318>, and they shall measure<WH4058> unto the cities<WH5892> which are round about<WH5439> him that is slain<WH2491>:

And it shall be, that the city<WH5892> which is next<WH7138> unto the slain man<WH2491>, even the elders<WH2205> of that city<WH5892> shall take<WH3947> an heifer<WH1241> <WH5697>, which hath not been wrought with<WH5647>, and which hath not drawn<WH4900> in the yoke<WH5923>;

And the elders<WH2205> of that city<WH5892> shall bring down<WH3381> the heifer<WH5697> unto a rough<WH386> valley<WH5158>, which is neither eared<WH5647> nor sown<WH2232>, and shall strike off<WH6202> the heifer's<WH5697> neck<WH6202> there in the valley<WH5158>:

And the priests<WH3548> the sons<WH1121> of Levi<WH3878> shall come near<WH5066>; for them the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath chosen<WH977> to minister<WH8334> unto him, and to bless<WH1288> in the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068>; and by their word<WH6310> shall every controversy<WH7379> and every stroke<WH5061> be tried: word: Heb. mouth

And all the elders<WH2205> of that city<WH5892>, that are next<WH7138> unto the slain<WH2491> man, shall wash<WH7364> their hands<WH3027> over the heifer<WH5697> that is beheaded<WH6202> in the valley<WH5158>:
And they shall answer<WH6030> and say<WH559>, Our hands<WH3027> have not shed<WH8210> this blood<WH1818>, neither have our eyes<WH5869> seen<WH7200> it.

Be merciful<WH3722>, O LORD<WH3068>, unto thy people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, whom thou hast redeemed<WH6299>, and lay<WH5414> not innocent<WH5355> blood<WH1818> unto thy people<WH5971> of Israel's<WH3478> charge<WH7130>. And the blood<WH1818> shall be forgiven<WH3722> them. unto thy people of: Heb. in the midst, etc
So shalt thou put away<WH1197> the guilt of innocent<WH5355> blood<WH1818> from among<WH7130> you, when thou shalt do<WH6213> that which is right<WH3477> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD<WH3068>.

When thou goest forth<WH3318> to war<WH4421> against thine enemies<WH341>, and the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath delivered<WH5414> them into thine hands<WH3027>, and thou hast taken<WH7617> them captive<WH7628>,
And seest<WH7200> among the captives<WH7633> a beautiful<WH8389> <WH3303> woman<WH802>, and hast a desire<WH2836> unto her, that thou wouldest have her<WH3947> to thy wife<WH802>;
Then thou shalt bring<WH935> her home<WH8432> to thine house<WH1004>; and she shall shave<WH1548> her head<WH7218>, and pare<WH6213> her nails<WH6856>; pare: or, suffer to grow: Heb. make, or, dress

And she shall put<WH5493> the raiment<WH8071> of her captivity<WH7628> from off her, and shall remain<WH3427> in thine house<WH1004>, and bewail<WH1058> her father<WH1> and her mother<WH517> a full<WH3117> month<WH3391>: and after<WH310> that thou shalt go<WH935> in unto her, and be her husband<WH1166>, and she shall be thy wife<WH802>.

And it shall be, if thou have no delight<WH2654> in her, then thou shalt let her go<WH7971> whither she will<WH5315>; but thou shalt not sell<WH4376> her at all<WH4376> for money<WH3701>, thou shalt not make merchandise<WH6014> of her, because<WH834> thou hast humbled<WH6031> her.

If a man<WH376> have two<WH8147> wives<WH802>, one<WH259> beloved<WH157>, and another<WH259> hated<WH8130>, and they have born<WH3205> him children<WH1121>, both the beloved<WH157> and the hated<WH8130>; and if the firstborn<WH1060> son<WH1121> be hers that was hated<WH8146>:

Then it shall be, when<WH3117> he maketh his sons<WH1121> to inherit<WH5157> that which he hath, that he may<WH3201> not make the son<WH1121> of the beloved<WH157> firstborn<WH1069> before<WH6440> the son<WH1121> of the hated<WH8130>, which is indeed the firstborn<WH1060>:

But he shall acknowledge<WH5234> the son<WH1121> of the hated<WH8130> for the firstborn<WH1060>, by giving<WH5414> him a double<WH8147> portion<WH6310> of all that he hath<WH4672>: for he is the beginning<WH7225> of his strength<WH202>; the right<WH4941> of the firstborn<WH1062> is his. that: Heb. that is found with him

If a man<WH376> have a stubborn<WH5637> and rebellious<WH4784> son<WH1121>, which will not obey<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of his father<WH1>, or the voice<WH6963> of his mother<WH517>, and that, when they have chastened<WH3256> him, will not hearken<WH8085> unto them:
Then shall his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517> lay hold<WH8610> on him, and bring him out<WH3318> unto the elders<WH2205> of his city<WH5892>, and unto the gate<WH8179> of his place<WH4725>;

And they shall say<WH559> unto the elders<WH2205> of his city<WH5892>, This our son<WH1121> is stubborn<WH5637> and rebellious<WH4784>, he will not obey<WH8085> our voice<WH6963>; he is a glutton<WH2151>, and a drunkard<WH5433>.

And all the men<WH582> of his city<WH5892> shall stone<WH7275> him with stones<WH68>, that he die<WH4191>: so shalt thou put<WH1197> evil<WH7451> away<WH1197> from among<WH7130> you; and all Israel<WH3478> shall hear<WH8085>, and fear<WH3372>.
And if a man<WH376> have committed a sin<WH2399> worthy of<WH4941> death<WH4194>, and he be to be put to death<WH4191>, and thou hang<WH8518> him on a tree<WH6086>:

His body<WH5038> shall not remain all night<WH3885> upon the tree<WH6086>, but thou shalt in any wise<WH6912> bury<WH6912> him that day<WH3117>; (for he that is hanged<WH8518> is accursed<WH7045> of God<WH430>;) that thy land<WH127> be not defiled<WH2930>, which the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee for an inheritance<WH5159>. accursed: Heb. the curse of God
